numbered_ace_sentences: 1. This graph compares two age groups.
4. The graph compares the percentages of these age groups.
5. The graph is about the view whether the world is getting better with each generation.
6. The younger generation is more optimistic than the older generation.
7. Most 15-24-year-olds believe that the world is getting better with each generation.
8. Many 40+-year-olds are not confident that the world is getting better with each generation.
10. Many people hope that everyone wishes that the world is getting better with each generation.
11. I wonder what younger generations have to do to persuade the older generation.
12. I wonder how these percentages will change in future years.
14. I am a member of the younger generation.
15. Many teenagers in my community believe that the world is getting better with each generation.
16. The headline is: Is each generation making the world better?
